channel.title: Grapic card driver problem
channel.description:
Well... I downgraded my windows vista home basic to windows xp professional. My vista was messed up so I had to downgrade. I didnt get any recovery cd/vista cd when I bought the laptop. I got my sound driver working now, wireless network driver and such, but I can figure out how to get my graphic card working fully.
I got a HP Compaq presario f500 laptop. nVidia 6100. (Everst says nVidia C51 now) Im not sure
I dont find a working driver(s)
I need help with this.
Thanks alot ;D
Also, could this be why I lag when I scroll down a website/document etc?

item.title: Grapic card driver problem
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

I ran a program called “Driver Genius Professional Edition” and it automaticly fixed my drivers!

But thx for everything! ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Grapic card driver problem
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“PeterMan, post:7, topic:203126”]I got this error: "The NVIDIA Smart Scan was unable to evaluate your system hardware. Please use Option 1 to manually find drivers for your NVIDIA products.

The NVIDIA Smart Scan tool is a BETA release. We welcome your feedback here. "[/quote]
Have you tried with Internett Explorer?

Read full topic

item.title: Grapic card driver problem
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

Since it’s a laptop the card is most likely onboard. So install the drivers, see what happens.

Read full topic

item.title: Grapic card driver problem
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

Well, I just ran this program called Everest

(btw, most of the things in MY everst program is in Norwegian as you can see)

And it found this on category Graphic card or something:

Last time my computer was at service they switched the motherboard and the hardrive. But they didnt say anything about graphics card. Coz when I bought the laptop, the ad said nVidia 6100 . Is this name (C51) just a more simple way of putting it or has my graphic card been switched? … It said nVidia 6100 when I had Vista btw.

Something to do with “chipset” i googled but didnt get much wiser

Read full topic

item.title: Grapic card driver problem
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

Ha, same exact thing I did. Except the “downgrade” was more of an upgrade

And an answer to your question, yes, that is why it lags.

http://www.nvidia.com/object/winxp_169.21_whql.html

That should do it.

Read full topic
